Infections and COVID-19

Dr Lovemore Kunorzva, PhD, Molecular and cell biologist

Dr Wayne Derman, MD, Professor

Summary

An infection occurs when disease causing “germs” usually a virus or bacteria enters the body. An infection often leads to symptoms such as fever, tiredness, pain, sore throat and runny nose. Unfortunately, infections are common in elite athletes, which is problematic as it leads to time loss from training. It is therefore important that you as a para athlete try to prevent infections. To prevent infections it is important that you;

  • Maintain physical distance of at least 1.5 meters from other individuals, even if they don’t appear to be sick.

  • Avoid places that are closed, crowded or involve close contact.

  • Clean your hands regularly and thoroughly, and surfaces with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water to kill viruses that maybe on your hands and surfaces.

  • Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth as these are common ways germs enter the body.

  • Get vaccinated! Vaccination can drastically reduce one’s chances of contracting many

  • Optimize sleep, recovery and nutrition, this will help your immune system to fight infections better.
